study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of common treatments, including cryotherapy, for plantar warts compared to no treatment and other interventions.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was not superior to no treatment in achieving complete response for plantar warts, suggesting limited efficacy. Traditional treatments like cryotherapy and salicylic acid may play a less important role in clinical practice compared to newer topical antimitotic treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with plantar warts (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryoablation, when added to curettage and burr drilling, reduces local recurrence rates and improves functional outcomes in patients with aneurysmal bone cysts (ABCs).
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in local recurrence rates (9.1% vs. 7.1%) or functional outcomes (MSTS93 scores: 28.9 vs. 27.8) between patients treated with or without cryoablation. Secondary ABC diagnosis was the only significant risk factor for recurrence.
population_specificity: Patients treated for aneurysmal bone cysts (ABCs) between January 2006 and December 2019.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety, efficacy, and durability of liquid nitrogen spray cryotherapy (SCT) for treating dysplastic Barrett's esophagus (BE) in a multicenter U.S. registry.
results_summary: SCT showed high rates of complete eradication of intestinal metaplasia (66-77%) and dysplasia (84-96%) over 2-3 years, with low adverse event rates (5.5% strictures, 0.7% perforation). Prior RFA treatment and longer BE length were associated with lower efficacy.
population_specificity: Adults with dysplastic BE or intramucosal adenocarcinoma (138 subjects: 24% low-grade dysplasia, 49% high-grade dysplasia, 27% intramucosal adenocarcinoma; 34% had prior RFA therapy).
effective_dosage: Median of 2 SCT sessions (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine which temperature settings on a continuous cold-flow cryocompression device effectively reduce knee skin temperature to the therapeutic range of 10-15°C for pain and swelling attenuation.
results_summary: The study found that device settings of 6°C and 8°C reduced skin temperature to the target range (10-15°C) within 20-25 minutes, while higher settings (10°C and 12°C) did not achieve this range within the 30-minute treatment. The median difference between device temperature and final skin temperature was smallest for the 12°C setting (5.7°C).
population_specificity: 32 healthy adults with no contraindications to cryocompressive therapy.
effective_dosage: Device temperature settings of 6°C, 8°C, 10°C, and 12°C applied for 30 minutes.

study_goal: To determine the effects of oral cryotherapy on anticipatory and acute nausea and vomiting in breast cancer patients receiving adjuvant chemotherapy.
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced anticipatory and acute nausea, vomiting, and retching scores compared to standard care, with consistent improvements across multiple chemotherapy cycles. The intervention was found to be effective and safe for managing these symptoms.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients receiving adjuvant chemotherapy (n=70).
effective_dosage: Ice application protocol in three stages: instruction, implementation at the hospital, and individual application at home.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of cryotherapy in postoperative shoulder patients, focusing on pain, range of motion, functionality, and temperature changes.
results_summary: The systematic review found that cryotherapy reduced pain and improved functionality in postoperative shoulder patients, though the methods of application varied. The included studies demonstrated consistent benefits but lacked uniformity in protocols.
population_specificity: 233 patients who underwent various shoulder surgeries.
effective_dosage: Not specified (methods included Cryo/Cuff, Cryoton, etc.).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore strategies, including cryotherapy, to mitigate the toxicity of high-dose melphalan in multiple myeloma patients undergoing hematopoietic cell transplantation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the established approaches to reduce toxicities associated with high-dose melphalan, such as myelosuppression, gastrointestinal issues, and mucositis, but does not provide specific results on its effectiveness.
population_specificity: Multiple myeloma patients undergoing autologous hematopoietic cell transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of vaginal cryotherapy on pelvic floor myofascial pain (PFMP) with palpation.
results_summary: Both in-office and at-home cryotherapy significantly reduced pain scores, though similar reductions were observed in the control group (room temperature therapy). The difference between cryotherapy and control groups was not statistically significant, suggesting potential placebo effects or therapeutic benefits from both treatments.
population_specificity: Individuals with pelvic floor myofascial pain (PFMP) and a pain score ≥4/10 in ≥1 of four muscle groups.
effective_dosage: Single in-office treatment or 2-week daily at-home treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in treating cutaneous sporotrichosis in a renal transplant recipient already on antifungal prophylaxis.
results_summary: The patient responded to treatment with cryotherapy and terbinafine, showing regression of skin lesions. The study suggests cryotherapy may be effective in combination with antifungal therapy for this condition.
population_specificity: 39-year-old renal allograft recipient with cutaneous sporotrichosis.
interactions: Increased tacrolimus levels when combined with itraconazole (later changed to terbinafine and cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cryotherapy and radiofrequency neurolysis on rhinitis-related symptoms and quality of life.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly improved rhinitis-related symptoms and quality of life over 12 months, though radiofrequency neurolysis was more effective, particularly for itching, rhinorrhea, and congestion. The minimal clinically important difference in symptom scores was achieved by 81.8% of cryotherapy patients after 3 months.
population_specificity: 738 patients with rhinitis-related symptoms enrolled across 10 studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on aromatase inhibitor-induced joint pain compared to placebo cryotherapy in hormone-dependent breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The study will assess WBC's impact on pain (measured by BPI-SF scores), analgesic consumption, hormone therapy adherence, and quality of life, with outcomes evaluated at week 6 and months 3 and 6 post-treatment. Adverse events will also be investigated.
population_specificity: Patients with hormone-dependent breast cancer experiencing aromatase inhibitor-induced joint pain (BPI-SF score ≥3).
effective_dosage: 10 sessions of WBC or placebo cryotherapy.
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated, but outcomes are tracked up to 6 months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy versus compression therapy versus placebo in preventing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) during taxane chemotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 41.1% success rate in preventing CIPN, similar to placebo but lower than compression therapy (64.7%). Adherence to cryotherapy was notably lower (35.0%) compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage breast cancer undergoing taxane chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: Garments were worn for 90-120 minutes, beginning 15 minutes prior and continuing for 15 minutes following the infusion.
study_duration: Intervention duration was per chemotherapy session, with outcomes assessed at 12 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the acceptability and efficacy of thermal ablation versus cryotherapy for treating cervical pre-cancer lesions in a screen-and-treat program.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed 92% efficacy in eliminating VIA-positive cervical lesions at six months, but had lower provider and client acceptability compared to thermal ablation. Immediate side effects and problems at six weeks and six months were assessed, but specific safety outcomes for cryotherapy were not detailed.
population_specificity: Women with VIA-positive cervical lesions in India.
study_duration: Follow-up at six weeks and six months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review adverse effects (AEs) associated with cryolipolysis, focusing on risks and complications reported in clinical data.
results_summary: The study found that cryolipolysis, while initially considered harmless, carries risks such as paradoxical adipose hyperplasia (PAH). Continued surveillance and research are needed to better understand these complications.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad review of clinical data).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of various treatments, including cryotherapy, for managing hamstring injuries in athletes.
results_summary: The study found that stretching exercises combined with cryotherapy showed benefits for hamstring injuries, though the specific effects of cryotherapy alone were not isolated. The overall efficacy of cryotherapy was implied but not conclusively demonstrated.
population_specificity: Athletes with hamstring injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current knowledge on HPV infection, including its virology, pathogenesis, clinical manifestations, and treatment options such as cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract states that cryotherapy, among other therapeutic procedures, cannot completely eliminate HPV, indicating limited efficacy in treating persistent infections. No specific outcomes or statistical results regarding cryotherapy are detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of HPV infection in humans).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of cryoablation of the posterior nasal nerve on rhinitis symptoms in patients with allergic rhinitis (AR) and non-allergic rhinitis (NAR).
results_summary: Cryoablation significantly improved rhinitis-related symptoms, particularly rhinorrhea and congestion, and enhanced disease-specific quality of life. The improvement was greater in NAR patients than in AR patients, with long-term efficacy more pronounced in NAR.
population_specificity: Patients with allergic rhinitis (AR) and non-allergic rhinitis (NAR).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the latest evidence on cryotherapy for palliation of dysphagia in patients with inoperable esophageal cancer.
results_summary: The abstract notes increasing data on cryotherapy, particularly for patients with mild-to-moderate dysphagia on systemic chemotherapy, suggesting it as a potential palliative option. However, it does not provide specific outcomes or comparative efficacy details.
population_specificity: Patients with inoperable esophageal cancer and mild-to-moderate dysphagia on systemic chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy using liquid nitrogen versus nitric-zinc complex solution (NZCS) in treating plantar warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a higher cure rate (65.5%) compared to NZCS (56.6%) and required fewer treatment applications (3.6 vs. 4.8). The number of applications was significantly lower in cured patients than in those with unresolved warts.
population_specificity: 62 patients with plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the histopathologic features, particularly folliculotropism (FLC), in non-responder actinic keratoses (AKs) and evaluate the discrepancy between dermoscopic and histological findings, including the potential limitations of superficial treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy may not provide a good response in deep hair follicles, particularly in AKs with folliculotropism (FLC). A significant discrepancy was observed between dermoscopic grading and histological findings, suggesting superficial treatments might be less effective for certain AK subtypes.
population_specificity: Patients with persistent AKs after two alternated cycles of topical treatments (ingenol mebutate, imiquimod, diclofenac 3%, or 5-fluorouracil), excluding those with immunosuppression or genetic diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the success rate and efficacy of cryoballoon ablation (CBA) in improving NYHA classification and left ventricular systolic function in patients with atrial fibrillation (AF) accompanied by heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF).
results_summary: The study found that cryoballoon ablation significantly improved left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) and NYHA classification in HFrEF patients, with 65% freedom from AF after 1 year and 39% after 2 years, and a low all-cause mortality rate of 3%.
population_specificity: 1699 heart failure patients, including 365 with HFrEF.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of intralesional bleomycin versus cryotherapy in treating cutaneous warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be effective in 74% of patients after 6 weeks, but significantly less effective than intralesional bleomycin (94.8%). The difference was statistically significant (p=0.001).
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-60 years with cutaneous warts lasting 1-48 weeks.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (method details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness and challenges of various scar treatment strategies, including cryotherapy, compared to newer methods like microneedle-mediated drug delivery.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy and other traditional strategies for scar treatment are often ineffective, have side effects, and are expensive, without providing specific results for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of scar treatment strategies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy versus fractional CO2 laser in achieving short-term hair regrowth ≥ 75% in patients with alopecia areata.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was less effective than fractional CO2 laser for short-term hair regrowth (RR 0.31, 95% CI 0.11 to 0.86), with very low-certainty evidence. No serious adverse events were reported for cryotherapy in this comparison.
population_specificity: Outpatients with alopecia areata, aged 2-74 years, recruited from dermatology clinics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of surgical and instrumental procedures, including cryotherapy, in improving nasal symptom scores and quality of life for adult patients with chronic rhinitis poorly controlled by medical treatment.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that surgical/instrumental procedures, including cryotherapy, improved total nasal symptom scores and quality of life compared to medical treatment, with a standardized mean difference of -1.27 (95% CI [-2.38; -0.16]).
population_specificity: Adult patients with chronic rhinitis not adequately controlled by medical treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare and rank the effectiveness of nonpharmacologic interventions, including cryotherapy, for alleviating chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed significant effects compared to usual care, with the highest likelihood of effectively alleviating CIPN, followed by exercise and self-acupressure. The study concluded that cryotherapy was the most effective nonpharmacologic intervention for CIPN in breast cancer patients.
population_specificity: Patients with breast cancer experiencing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, risks, and benefits of salvage radiotherapy (SRT) after cryotherapy failure for localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: The review confirms the feasibility of SRT in terms of biochemical control and late toxicity rate, but highlights the need for cautious consideration due to the absence of comparative trials, patient heterogeneity, and treatment variations. The authors recommend further clinical trials to assess efficacy and safety comprehensively.
population_specificity: Patients with local prostate cancer recurrence after cryotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with anti-VEGF injections as potential management strategies for peripheral exudative hemorrhagic chorioretinopathy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the explored management strategies but does not provide specific findings regarding its effects. Anti-VEGF was highlighted as effective, especially for exudative threats to the macula.
population_specificity: Patients with peripheral exudative hemorrhagic chorioretinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy as a treatment for disseminated superficial actinic porokeratosis (DSAP) compared to other therapies.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy, along with other treatments, has shown limited efficacy and caused adverse effects such as inflammatory reactions, hyperpigmentation, pain, and erythema. No specific results for cryotherapy alone are detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with disseminated superficial actinic porokeratosis (DSAP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the safety concerns associated with true whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) by evaluating adverse events documented in case reports and randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The study found that WBC-related safety risks are within acceptable limits when existing recommendations and contraindications are followed, with 16 documented adverse events across five case reports and two RCTs. WBC was also noted to improve sleep quality, neuromuscular recovery, chronic pain, mental health, and cognitive functions.
population_specificity: Adults and older adults, including patients with fibromyalgia, rheumatism, arthritis, depression, and anxiety disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate treatments for men with chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CPPS), including cryotherapy, within the biopsychosocial model of care.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was listed among nonpharmacologic interventions for CPPS, but the abstract does not provide specific findings on its effectiveness compared to other treatments. The study concluded that combining treatment modalities may improve outcomes.
population_specificity: Men with chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CPPS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the acute effects of active recovery, hot-water immersion, and cold-water immersion (CWI) on performance recovery between two training sessions in elite athletes.
results_summary: The study found that average power output was slightly but significantly higher for active recovery and hot-water immersion compared to cold-water immersion during a repeated-sprint cycling session.
population_specificity: Twelve national-team skaters (7 males, 5 females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of recruitment for a cohort-embedded RCT comparing cryoablation (CRA) to robotic partial nephrectomy (RPN) in managing small renal masses (SRMs).
results_summary: Cryoablation showed a lower postoperative complication rate (12%) compared to RPN (29%) and a shorter median hospital stay (1 vs. 2 days). At 6 months, renal function change was modest (-5.0 ml/min/1.73 m²).
population_specificity: Patients with small renal masses (SRMs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of risk stratification and the efficacy of local salvage therapies, including cryotherapy, for managing biochemical recurrence in prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to have comparable relapse-free survival rates to other local salvage therapies but with differing adverse event profiles, both short and long term. The study suggests cryotherapy is appropriate for local-only relapses.
population_specificity: Patients with biochemical recurrence after radical prostatectomy or external beam radiotherapy for prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of cryotherapy in the acute phase after total knee replacement (TKR) on outcomes such as blood loss, pain, transfusion rate, range of motion, and adverse events.
results_summary: Cryotherapy may reduce blood loss and slightly improve pain and range of motion, but the evidence is of low certainty. No significant benefits were found for transfusion rate, function, or adverse events, and the certainty of evidence for these outcomes was very low.
population_specificity: Adults aged 64-74 years who underwent TKR for osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (application methods included ice or cooled water via specialized devices).
study_duration: Within 48 hours after surgery, with follow-up assessments up to 13 days post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the genetic and molecular features of retinoblastoma, including traditional and innovative treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract highlights cryotherapy as one of the treatment strategies for retinoblastoma, alongside chemotherapy and thermotherapy, but does not provide specific results on its effectiveness. It emphasizes the importance of early diagnosis and advanced treatment techniques for improving survival rates.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with retinoblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of cryotherapy on the quality of life in pediatric patients with viral warts and molluscum contagiosum.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy negatively impacted the quality of life in pediatric patients, primarily due to pain associated with the treatment. The impairment was significant enough to recommend less painful alternatives.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with viral warts and molluscum contagiosum managed in a dermatology clinic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of an opioid-free pain management pathway (including cryotherapy) versus an opioid-containing pathway for pain control after thumb CMC joint arthroplasty.
results_summary: The opioid-free group (which included cryotherapy) had statistically noninferior and lower pain scores at 24 hours and 2 weeks postoperatively compared to the opioid-containing group, with no difference in side effects or patient satisfaction. Pain scores became similar by 6 weeks.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary thumb CMC joint arthroplasty.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy was part of a multimodal approach).
study_duration: Assessed at 24 hours, 2 weeks, and 6 weeks postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy versus plasma exeresis for treating seborrheic keratoses.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed lower lesion clearance rates (17.1% at week 3, 20.7% at week 6) compared to plasma exeresis, with no significant difference in side effects. The most common complication was hypo-pigmentation (38.46%).
population_specificity: 35 males with seborrheic keratoses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate whether cryotherapy reduces the incidence and severity of oral mucositis (OM) induced by cancer therapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced the incidence of severe OM, particularly in patients with solid cancers, but showed no significant effect on OM duration or in patients with hematological malignancies.
population_specificity: Patients with cancer undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy, including subgroups with solid cancers and hematological malignancies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy for treating alopecia areata (AA) and compare it with intralesional and topical corticosteroid therapies.
results_summary: Approximately 60% of patients responded to cryotherapy with hair regrowth, and relapse rates were potentially lower compared to steroid treatments, though efficacy differences were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients with alopecia areata, including recalcitrant cases.
effective_dosage: Not specified (treatment protocols varied between studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical outcomes of bronchoscopic cryotherapy (BC) for central airway obstruction (CAO) and identify factors associated with its complications.
results_summary: BC achieved more than partial re-establishment of airway patency in 90.6% of sessions, with intrabronchial bleeding being the most common complication (35.5%), though severe bleeding was rare (0.4%). Diabetes mellitus, respiratory failure before BC, and absence of distal airway atelectasis were identified as potential risk factors for moderate to severe bleeding.
population_specificity: Patients with central airway obstruction (CAO) who underwent bronchoscopic cryotherapy at Asan Medical Center, South Korea.
study_duration: Data collected from January 2009 to December 2020 (retrospective study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pre-clinical and clinical evidence for cryoablation in non-small cell lung cancer and its potential to induce anti-tumor immunity, particularly in combination with systemic immunotherapies.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryoablation may induce immunogenic cell death and synergize with systemic immunotherapies, improving response rates in lung cancer treatment. Ongoing studies and future investigations are highlighted to further explore this approach.
population_specificity: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy among various non-operative treatment options for patellar tendinopathy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several non-operative treatments for patellar tendinopathy but does not provide specific efficacy data or comparative outcomes for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Professional and recreational athletes, particularly those involved in jumping sports.

study_goal: The researchers assessed the effectiveness of a gel containing panthenol, tocopheryl acetate, and Propionibacterium extract in treating anal warts, with cryotherapy as a secondary intervention for non-responsive cases.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was required in 24.1% of patients who did not respond to the gel treatment. The study did not focus on cryotherapy's efficacy or safety but noted its use as a secondary treatment option.
population_specificity: Patients with perianal and endoanal condylomata (median age 33, 72.2% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the cellular and subcellular effects of cryotherapy on myocardiocytes, particularly its role in autophagy regulation and reactive oxygen species reduction.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy (32-34°C) upregulates autophagy, reduces reactive oxygen species production, and enhances cellular antioxidant defenses, with optimal therapeutic effects at 33°C when applied at reperfusion onset.
population_specificity: Injured myocardiocytes, including infarcted myocardiocytes, anginal, and cardiomyopathies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of combined Er:YAG and long-pulsed Nd:YAG laser therapy versus Er:YAG laser alone for treating recalcitrant warts after one session.
results_summary: The study found that the combined laser therapy had a statistically significant higher clearance rate (48%) compared to Er:YAG laser alone (29%). Cryotherapy was mentioned as a prior failed treatment for the warts.
population_specificity: 24 patients with 240 recalcitrant wart lesions that failed topical treatment and cryotherapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (single session of laser therapy).
study_duration: Single session, with evaluation 5 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy could effectively manage pain and reduce opioid use after arthroscopic surgery.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, along with other noninvasive modalities like TENS and zolpidem, effectively managed pain and reduced opioid consumption, though the evidence was limited to a small number of studies.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing shoulder, knee, and hip arthroscopy (total of 2,148 patients across 21 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the oncological profile of focal cryotherapy as a treatment for localized prostate cancer and assess its cancer control outcomes.
results_summary: The study included 24 papers on focal cryotherapy, showing variability in biochemical recurrence rates and salvage treatment rates, but specific efficacy data for cryotherapy were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess breast cancer patients' motivations and experiences regarding participation in a clinical trial testing cryotherapy for preventing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.
results_summary: The study identified key themes influencing participation, including altruism, personal resources, safety perceptions, and randomization experiences. Patients in both intervention and control groups viewed additional trial examinations as enhancing safety, but efficacy outcomes were not explicitly detailed.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients treated with paclitaxel (n=21).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the recurrence rates and reporting consistency of pathologic scar treatment using intralesional triamcinolone (TAC) in combination with other agents, including cryotherapy (CRY).
results_summary: Cryotherapy (TAC-CRY) was among the combination therapies that reported 0% recurrence in some studies, but recurrence rate reporting was inconsistent across studies. Long-term follow-up (18-24 months) is needed to better characterize recurrence rates.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertrophic scars (HTS) and keloids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety profile and functional outcomes of focal cryotherapy as a treatment for low- to intermediate-risk localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that focal cryotherapy had a post-operative pad-free rate between 92.3-100%, indicating good urinary function preservation, but showed wide heterogeneity in erectile function outcomes (0-94.4%). Common complications included hematuria, infections, and urethral strictures, with varying rates.
population_specificity: Patients with low- to intermediate-risk localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: To investigate whether cryotherapy combined with photodynamic therapy (PDT) improves the efficacy of treating actinic keratosis (AK) compared to other methods.
results_summary: Cryotherapy + PDT showed the best efficacy among the tested treatments, with high clinical, dermoscopic, and RCM response rates (97.1%, 88.6%, and 85.7%, respectively). The combination was well tolerated and significantly improved PDT outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis (AK).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy with other salvage treatments (including brachytherapy) for recurrent prostate cancer after definitive radiotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 5-year recurrence-free survival rate of 50%, comparable to other salvage treatments, with a severe genitourinary toxicity rate of 15%, which was lower than some alternatives but higher than partial gland brachytherapy.
population_specificity: Men with recurrent prostate cancer after definitive external beam radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the mid- to long-term oncological and functional outcomes of whole-gland cryoablation for localized prostate cancer and provide expert recommendations based on real-world data.
results_summary: Cryoablation showed favorable oncological outcomes, with 10-year biochemical recurrence-free survival at 58% and cancer-specific survival at 96%. Functional outcomes were strong, with 96% pad-free continence and 37% erectile function preservation, though adverse events like stricture (11%) and urinary retention (9.5%) were noted.
population_specificity: Patients with clinically localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the implementation and impact of a single-visit screen-and-treat approach using VIA and thermal ablation compared to cryotherapy for cervical cancer prevention in Kenya.
results_summary: The study found that while cryotherapy has established efficacy, its population-level coverage and impact on reducing cervical cancer burden remain low, with up to 70% of screen-positive women not receiving treatment. Thermal ablation was proposed as a potential solution to overcome logistical challenges associated with cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Women aged 30-49 in central Kenya, particularly those attending reproductive health clinics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether preemptive acupuncture plus acupressure, alongside standard-of-care cryotherapy, could reduce chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and other toxicities in GI oncology patients receiving oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract describes a study protocol, so no results regarding cryotherapy's effects are reported yet. The study is designed to assess CIPN severity and incidence, along with other symptoms, at baseline, 6 weeks, and 3 months.
population_specificity: Patients with gastrointestinal malignancies (n=56) planned to receive 5-fluorouracil and oxaliplatin IV (FOLFOX, FOLFIRINOX) every 2 weeks.
effective_dosage: Standard-of-care oral and peripheral (hands/feet) ice chip cryotherapy during oxaliplatin administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current therapeutic options for ocular cancers, including cryotherapy, and explore the potential of bioactive phytocompounds as alternatives.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the current treatments for ocular cancers but does not provide specific findings about its effects.
population_specificity: Patients with ocular cancers (e.g., ocular melanoma, retinoblastoma, squamous cell carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of sodium hypochlorite (NaOCl) at different concentrations and temperatures (including cryotherapy at 2.5°C) on post-endodontic pain in patients with irreversible pulpitis.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in pain intensity or analgesic use between NaOCl concentrations (0.5% and 1%) or temperatures (2.5°C, 22°C, and 40°C). Pain decreased immediately after treatment but increased at 3 hours post-treatment, with no lasting differences between groups.
population_specificity: 72 patients with mandibular molars diagnosed with irreversible pulpitis.
effective_dosage: NaOCl concentrations of 0.5% and 1%, applied at temperatures of 2.5°C, 22°C, and 40°C during root canal irrigation.
study_duration: Pain was assessed before, immediately after, and at 3, 24, 48, and 72 hours post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect and methods of cryotherapy in reducing swelling after total knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in swelling reduction in six out of eight reviewed trials. Cryotherapy application times varied from 10-20 minutes with ice packs to up to 48 hours with automated devices, with durations ranging from 2 days to 1 week or until discharge.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty.
effective_dosage: Frequency varied from 2 to 72 times per day; application time was 10-20 minutes (ice packs) or up to 48 hours (automated devices).
study_duration: 2 days to 1 week or until discharge.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various treatments, including cryotherapy, for oral mucositis in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was among the diverse treatments assessed for oral mucositis, but the abstract does not specify its individual efficacy compared to other interventions. The study highlighted several effective treatments, but cryotherapy's specific results were not detailed.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy who developed oral mucositis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of dynamic soft tissue mobilization (DSTM) and proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (PNF) stretching, both combined with cryotherapy, in managing hamstring tightness, pain, and physical functionality in knee osteoarthritis (KOA) patients.
results_summary: Both DSTM and PNF stretching, combined with cryotherapy, showed significant improvements in hamstring flexibility, pain reduction, and functional mobility, with no significant differences between the two treatments. Cryotherapy was used adjunctively but its specific effects were not isolated in the results.
population_specificity: 48 patients with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy was given alongside other treatments).
study_duration: 4 weeks (3 sessions per week, totaling 12 sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of liquid nitrogen spray cryotherapy in improving dysphagia and quality of life in patients with inoperable esophageal cancer receiving systemic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was safe and associated with improved dysphagia and quality of life, with more intensive treatment showing greater improvement. No reflux was reported as an adverse effect.
population_specificity: Adults with inoperable esophageal cancer.
effective_dosage: Mean of 3.2 cryotherapy sessions (total 175 procedures across 55 patients).
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up duration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and tolerability of cryotherapy in preventing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and improving the quality of life for cancer patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed benefit in small trials for preventing CIPN, but concerns about tolerability were noted. Scalp cooling, which shares a similar mechanism, was found effective and tolerable in randomized studies for limiting chemotherapy-induced alopecia.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of cryotherapy in enhancing pulpal anesthesia during endodontic treatment of mandibular first permanent molars with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis in adolescents.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced intraoperative pain and increased the success rate of anesthesia compared to conventional IANB, though supplemental anesthesia was still often required. The cryotherapy group had a lower need for additional intraligamentary injections.
population_specificity: Adolescents aged 10-17 years with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis in mandibular first permanent molars.
effective_dosage: Ice packs applied for 5 minutes in the buccal vestibule.
study_duration: 5 minutes of cryotherapy application, with procedures starting after 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the oncologic effectiveness, morbidity, and side-effects of Cryotherapy and other focal therapies for low-risk prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed biochemical recurrence rates between 4.5% and 23%, with up to 20% of patients requiring salvage radical treatment. Erectile dysfunction and urinary incontinence incidence ranged from 3%-50% and 0%-34%, respectively.
population_specificity: Low-risk prostate cancer patients, with limited data on intermediate and high-risk patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various treatment approaches, including cryotherapy, in reducing recurrence rates for solid/multicystic ameloblastoma (SMA).
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with curettage ranked second in reducing recurrence rates (SUCRA score 66.9), following segmental resection (77.7). The evidence certainty was low due to imprecision and within-study bias.
population_specificity: Patients with solid/multicystic ameloblastoma (180 patients across 7 observational studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the safety and practice variations of spray cryotherapy (SCT) as an adjunctive treatment for benign airway stenosis (BAS).
results_summary: SCT was associated with a low rate of complications, including rare instances of pneumothorax and hypoxemia, with no cases of air embolism, hemodynamic compromise, or mortality. Procedural aspects of SCT varied widely, including actuation duration and timing relative to other interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with benign airway stenosis (BAS) who underwent at least one SCT session across seven academic institutions.
effective_dosage: Most frequent SCT actuation time per cycle was five seconds (specific dosage not detailed).
study_duration: Procedures occurred from 2013 to 2022 (retrospective study, intervention duration per session not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of intracanal cryotherapy on inflammatory biomarkers and pain levels in patients with asymptomatic apical periodontitis, comparing it to a control group.
results_summary: The study found a significant correlation between interappointment pain and levels of IL-1β and PGE, suggesting cryotherapy may influence inflammatory responses. However, the abstract does not provide complete results on biomarker changes or pain outcomes between groups.
population_specificity: 44 patients aged 18-35 years with asymptomatic apical periodontitis in mandibular pre-molar teeth.
effective_dosage: Final irrigation with distilled water at 2.5°C (cryotherapy group) or room temperature (control group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of various interventions, including cryotherapy, for treating molluscum contagiosum in immunocompetent individuals.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be significantly more effective than placebo in achieving complete clearance of molluscum contagiosum lesions (OR 16.81, 95% CI 4.13-68.54), ranking second only to ingenol mebutate. However, data on adverse effects were insufficient for quantitative analysis.
population_specificity: Immunocompetent children and adults with genital or non-genital molluscum contagiosum lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in sphincter preservation and its effectiveness in treating low rectal cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy successfully preserved sphincters in all 35 patients, with 88.57% showing no recurrence at follow-up. T stage was identified as a risk factor for local recurrence, and complications were mild (grades I-II).
population_specificity: Patients with low rectal cancer who underwent cryotherapy intervention between January 2016 and December 2020.
study_duration: Follow-up period of more than 2 years

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether alkane vapocoolant spray reduces pain during arteriovenous access cannulation in adult hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Vapocoolant spray significantly reduced subjective and objective pain scores compared to placebo or no treatment, with no differences in physiological parameters like blood pressure or heart rate. Post-hoc tests confirmed its superiority over both placebo and no intervention.
population_specificity: Adult patients undergoing hemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of combining home-based exercise with cryotherapy on improving daily living activities in patients with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found that patients receiving cryotherapy alongside home-based exercise showed statistically significant improvements in pain, stiffness, physical function, and total daily activity scores compared to control groups. These benefits were sustained at the 3-month follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with knee osteoarthritis recruited from a specialized rheumatic and medical rehabilitation center in Duhok, Iraq.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of Cryotherapy with other salvage treatments for locally recurrent prostate cancer after primary external beam radiotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed 5-year relapse-free survival rates similar to other treatments (50%-60%) but carried significant risks for severe genitourinary toxicity (10%-27%) and gastrointestinal toxicity (<2%). Early partial-gland salvage techniques showed promise with lower toxicity.
population_specificity: Patients with locally recurrent prostate cancer following primary external beam radiotherapy without distant metastasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as part of a comprehensive rehabilitation program for ankle sprains in athletes.
results_summary: The study suggests that cryotherapy, along with other rehabilitation techniques, can aid in recovery from ankle sprains by reducing edema and improving functional outcomes. However, the abstract does not provide specific data on cryotherapy's isolated efficacy.
population_specificity: Athletes with ankle sprains

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, cosmetic results, and adverse effects of cryotherapy with other treatments (like PDT and imiquimod) for actinic keratoses.
results_summary: The study found that PDT was significantly more effective than cryotherapy for complete response and cosmetic results, though recurrence rates were similar. Cryotherapy's efficacy was not highlighted as superior in any measured outcome.
population_specificity: 3,850 participants with 24,747 actinic keratosis lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety profile of ClariFix, a novel intranasal cryotherapy device, for treating chronic rhinitis.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in validated outcome scores post-treatment across all studies, with consistent improvements at multiple time intervals. Only minor adverse effects (e.g., pain, discomfort, headache, palate numbness) were reported, and no major adverse events occurred.
population_specificity: Patients of all ages with chronic rhinitis (allergic and non-allergic).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether combining cryotherapy with immune checkpoint inhibitors could enhance treatment response in advanced soft tissue sarcomas and assess ctDNA as a biomarker for monitoring response.
results_summary: The study found that combining cryotherapy with immunotherapy did not increase the response rate of STS to immunotherapy. ctDNA levels were negatively associated with treatment response, and changes in ctDNA post-cryotherapy correlated with progression-free survival.
population_specificity: 30 patients with unresectable or metastatic soft tissue sarcomas.
effective_dosage: Cryoablation performed between cycles 1 and 2 of immunotherapy (ipilimumab and nivolumab for four doses, followed by nivolumab alone).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but follow-up included progression-free survival (median 2.7 months) and overall survival (median 12.0 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent developments in the management of hemorrhoids, including safety, clinical efficacy, and marketed formulations.
results_summary: The abstract does not specifically mention Cryotherapy or its effects, focusing instead on newer molecules and past studies for hemorrhoid management.
population_specificity: Not specified (general hemorrhoid patients implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of cryotherapy in improving the success of inferior alveolar nerve blocks (IANB) for pain reduction during pulpectomy in children with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis (SIP) and to evaluate its impact on children's behavior.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly improved IANB success (79.2% vs. 50.6% in controls) and reduced pain severity, while also enhancing children's positive behavior during the procedure.
population_specificity: 170 healthy children aged five to nine years with carious primary mandibular second molars and SIP.
effective_dosage: Ice packs applied after IANB administration (specific duration/frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Duration of cryotherapy application not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy could reduce the incidence of persistent chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) in breast cancer patients receiving weekly paclitaxel-based chemotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a numerical but non-significant reduction in persistent CIPN incidence (15.8% vs. 36.8% in controls). Age ≥ 65 was identified as a significant risk factor for persistent CIPN.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients receiving adjuvant weekly paclitaxel-based chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy and acupressure in reducing pain during arteriovenous fistula (AVF) cannulation in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy resulted in mild pain reduction during AVF cannulation, but it did not significantly reduce pain compared to routine care. There was no significant difference in pain reduction between cryotherapy and acupressure.
population_specificity: 39 hemodialysis patients requiring AVF cannulation.
effective_dosage: Ice cube massage applied to the Hegu point for 10 minutes before cannulation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine when the lowest intraoral temperature is achieved during cryotherapy to optimize oral mucositis prevention.
results_summary: The greatest drop in intraoral temperature occurred after 5 minutes of cooling with ice chips or the intraoral cooling device, suggesting rapid cooling efficacy. The study did not report clinical outcomes for oral mucositis prevention, focusing instead on temperature changes.
population_specificity: 20 healthy volunteers
effective_dosage: Ice chips and intraoral cooling device set to 8°C and 15°C, respectively, for 30-minute sessions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy of PDT alone and adjunctive PDT in treating Extramammary Paget disease (EMPD), comparing it with other treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results for cryotherapy, focusing instead on PDT outcomes. Cryotherapy is mentioned as one of the noninvasive techniques used in EMPD management, but no data on its efficacy or safety are presented.
population_specificity: Patients with Extramammary Paget disease (EMPD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral zinc gluconate combined with cryotherapy was more effective than cryotherapy alone in treating anogenital warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced the number of genital warts in both groups, but adding oral zinc gluconate showed no significant advantage over placebo. The zinc group reported higher gastrointestinal adverse effects.
population_specificity: 50 patients suffering from genital warts.
effective_dosage: Not specified (oral zinc gluconate and placebo, with four sessions of cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of photobiomodulation and oral cryotherapy in preventing oral mucositis in patients undergoing hematological stem cell transplantation (HSCT) with chemo-conditioning.
results_summary: Both photobiomodulation and cryotherapy effectively reduced oral mucositis severity, incidence, duration, and pain, with no significant differences between the two interventions. The effectiveness varied based on chemo-conditioning regimens.
population_specificity: Patients with hematological stem cell transplantation (HSCT) receiving chemo-conditioning.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in managing conjunctival melanoma, particularly in early-stage cases, and its role in minimizing metastasis risk.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, when combined with "no touch" surgery at experienced centers, provides excellent outcomes for small conjunctival melanomas. Advanced cases require more individualized management, and early detection with directed treatment is critical to prevent metastasis.
population_specificity: Patients with conjunctival melanoma, particularly those with small tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of mild cryotherapy using instant-ice packs to reduce nail toxicity in breast cancer patients receiving paclitaxel chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that mild cryotherapy reduced grade 2 nail toxicity to 17.9%, with onycholysis being the most common. Grade 1 toxicity occurred in 63.5% of patients, primarily nail discoloration, while 25.4% reported no toxicity. The intervention was well-tolerated, with no severe pain or adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: 67 taxane-naïve breast cancer patients aged 18-74 years.
effective_dosage: Instant-ice packs applied at -5 °C to +5 °C for 70 minutes during paclitaxel infusion.
study_duration: Weekly during paclitaxel chemotherapy (median time to onset of grade 2 toxicity: 56 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review prospective data on keloid treatments, including cryotherapy, to evaluate their effectiveness and safety.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy, only mentioning it as one of the treatments requiring further study.
population_specificity: Patients with keloids (pathologic scars).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of ultrasound therapy alone versus ultrasound therapy combined with cryotherapy in treating subacute Achilles tendinopathy.
results_summary: Both groups showed significant improvement over time, but the Cryo-Ultrasound Group demonstrated greater pain and functional improvement compared to the Ultrasound Group. The study concluded that combining cryotherapy with ultrasound therapy may synergistically enhance therapeutic outcomes.
population_specificity: Amateur runners who ran at least 3 times a week with subacute midportion Achilles tendinopathy.
effective_dosage: 10 sessions of ultrasound therapy with cryotherapy (frequency not specified).
study_duration: Duration of intervention not explicitly stated, but involved 10 therapy sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of focal cryotherapy on functional outcomes and early efficacy in treating clinically significant prostate cancer (csPCa).
results_summary: Focal cryotherapy caused transient urinary and sexual function deterioration, resolving by 3 months posttreatment, and demonstrated reasonable early efficacy in well-selected csPCa patients.
population_specificity: Men with clinically significant prostate cancer (PSA ≤20 ng/mL, Gleason grade group ≤4, and specific mpMRI lesion volume criteria).
effective_dosage: Not specified (focal cryotherapy applied with a minimum 5 mm margin around target lesions).
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at 1, 3, 6, and 12 months posttreatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge about the clinical and histological appearance, epidemiology, pathogenesis, and treatment of seborrheic keratosis, including cryotherapy as one of the treatment options.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a treatment option for seborrheic keratosis, but it does not provide specific results regarding its effectiveness compared to other treatments. Treatment should be individualized based on clinical picture and patient preference.
population_specificity: Patients with seborrheic keratosis, a common benign epidermal tumor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how preoperative treatments, including cryotherapy, affect the recurrence rate of basal cell carcinoma (BCC) after Mohs micrographic surgery (MMS).
results_summary: The study found that previously treated BCC, including cases treated with cryotherapy, had a 2.44 times higher recurrence rate after MMS compared to primary BCC. However, cryotherapy-specific outcomes were not separately analyzed.
population_specificity: Patients with basal cell carcinoma (BCC), including those previously treated with cryotherapy or other methods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy and mitomycin microneedling in treating plantar warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was effective in 56.7% of patients, requiring an average of 4 sessions for complete remission, but was less effective than mitomycin microneedling (76.7% cure rate). Pain was the commonest adverse effect for both treatments.
population_specificity: 60 patients with plantar warts at the Skin Department CMH Abbottabad.
effective_dosage: Liquid nitrogen cryotherapy with a freeze-thaw cycle of 20 secs, repeated every 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy (coolant spray) in providing analgesia for elderly patients with rib fractures due to blunt thoracic trauma.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy significantly reduced pain scores (visual analog scale) at multiple time points (10th to 60th minute) compared to placebo, with higher clinical effectiveness in the coolant spray group. The differences were statistically significant (p<0.001).
population_specificity: Geriatric patients (aged 65+) with rib fractures from blunt thoracic trauma.
effective_dosage: Not specified (coolant spray application frequency/duration not detailed).
study_duration: Measurements taken up to 360 minutes (6 hours) post-application.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effectiveness of various non-surgical treatments, including cryotherapy, for insertional Achilles tendinopathy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects, as the study focused on comparing multiple treatments and found eccentric exercise plus soft tissue therapy to be the most effective for short-term pain.
population_specificity: Adults with insertional Achilles tendinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining cryotherapy with imiquimod and photodynamic therapy for treating actinic keratosis (AK).
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed that imiquimod/cryotherapy significantly improved complete clinical clearance of AK lesions compared to cryotherapy alone. No serious systemic adverse events were reported in any treatment arm.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis (AK).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether ice packs as a supplement to standard pain management could reduce postoperative pain and opioid usage following laparoscopic hysterectomy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in pain scores or opioid requirements between the ice pack group and the standard care group, though most intervention subjects reported willingness to use ice again and recommend it to others.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing outpatient laparoscopic hysterectomy for benign conditions, excluding those with chronic pain, current opioid use, or planned overnight hospitalizations.
effective_dosage: Ice packs were placed on the abdomen in the operating room (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated, but outcomes were assessed on postoperative day 1.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of intralesional PPD immunotherapy alone versus combined cryotherapy and PPD for treating multiple common warts.
results_summary: Both treatments significantly reduced wart size and number, with combined cryotherapy and PPD potentially reducing the number of required treatment sessions. The study concluded both methods are safe and effective.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with multiple common warts.
effective_dosage: Treatments every 2 weeks for up to four sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of ClariFix cryoablation in managing symptoms of chronic rhinitis, focusing on changes in reflective total nasal symptom score (rTNSS).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a significant reduction in rTNSS at 1 and 3 months post-treatment, indicating symptomatic improvement. However, the authors noted the need for higher-quality randomized controlled trials to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic rhinitis (247 individuals across 5 studies).
study_duration: Outcomes measured at 1 and 3 months postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in preventing or reducing the severity of oral mucositis induced by cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy showed some degree of efficacy in preventing or reducing the severity of mucositis when used with most anticancer treatments, though specific efficacy details were not provided.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or both.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy among various treatment options for vitreous hemorrhage.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several treatment options for vitreous hemorrhage but does not provide specific results or comparative efficacy data for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with vitreous hemorrhage due to conditions like proliferative diabetic retinopathy, vascular occlusion, trauma, or retinal breaks.

study_goal: To compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy, alone and in combination with sucrose, in minimizing pain during local anesthesia administration in children.
results_summary: The study found that a combination of cryotherapy and sucrose was statistically significantly more effective in reducing pain during anesthesia compared to conventional topical anesthetic agents, providing a positive dental experience.
population_specificity: 132 healthy and cooperative children aged 7-11 years requiring bilateral extraction of primary molars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the occurrence of Koebner phenomenon (KP) in Kaposi's sarcoma (KS) patients, including cases triggered by medical procedures like cryotherapy.
results_summary: Among 31 KS patients who developed KP, 4 (13%) had lesions after cryotherapy, indicating that cryotherapy can trigger KS in susceptible individuals. The study highlights the importance of minimizing skin trauma in KS patients.
population_specificity: 524 patients diagnosed with KS between 2009 and 2021, with 31 developing KP.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the occurrence of secondary cataract in retinoblastoma patients treated with various therapies, including Cryotherapy, over a 10-year period.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was applied in 57.1% of cases, but the study did not specifically evaluate its efficacy or safety; it focused on cataract development as a late complication of multiple treatments.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with retinoblastoma treated at the National Institute of Pediatrics of Mexico (INP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and adverse events of cryotherapy with other treatment modalities for solar lentigines.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a low pooled response rate (15%) compared to other treatments and had a moderate adverse event rate (33%). It was less efficacious than combination-based and laser-based treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with solar lentigines (1,763 total patients across 48 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the tolerability, side effects, and temperature reduction of air oral cryotherapy (using an intra-oral air-cooling device) versus ice oral cryotherapy in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: Both cryotherapy methods were tolerated, with ice OC causing more discomfort from cold, sensitive teeth, and numbness, while air OC caused more discomfort from swallowing. Temperature reductions were similar between methods, except for a greater reduction in the dorsal posterior tongue with ice OC.
population_specificity: 15 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cold-water immersion (CWI) against other recovery modalities on athletic performance, perceptual outcomes, and creatine kinase levels following acute strenuous exercise in physically active populations.
results_summary: CWI was superior to other recovery methods for reducing muscle soreness and similar for muscular power and flexibility recovery. Air cryotherapy was more effective than CWI for muscular strength recovery and immediate power recovery post-exercise.
population_specificity: Physically active individuals involved in sports.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, safety, and acceptability of three ablation treatments, including cryotherapy, for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2 or higher.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was safe and highly acceptable to patients, though pain levels and side effects varied across treatments. Early data suggested no significant safety concerns.
population_specificity: 1,152 eligible women with biopsy-confirmed cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2 or higher from El Salvador, China, and Colombia.
study_duration: Pain measured before, during, and after treatment; side effects and acceptability assessed at 6 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on the efficacy of cryotherapy in reducing pain and improving outcomes in knee arthroplasty patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a decrease in pain levels, but results for range of motion and functionality were inconsistent. The meta-analysis could not confirm definitive effects due to methodological biases in the studies.
population_specificity: Patients aged 51-74 years undergoing knee arthroplasty for end-stage osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of various intralesional treatments, including Cryotherapy, for plantar warts over the past decade.
results_summary: The study found that Cryotherapy was less effective than intralesional vitamin D3, Candida antigen, and bleomycin for treating recalcitrant plantar warts. No specific efficacy data for Cryotherapy was provided, but it was noted as inferior to other treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of endoscopic balloon cryoablation (EBCA) with a single instillation of pirarubicin after transurethral resection (TUR) for treating non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer.
results_summary: EBCA showed superior local control rates (91.5% vs. 76.5%) and better recurrence-free and progression-free survival compared to single instillation therapy, with no significant difference in serious adverse events (3.0% vs. 3.9%).
population_specificity: Patients with non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy procedure details not quantified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy with other treatments for actinic keratosis (AKs) in reducing lesions and preventing skin cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be non-inferior to other treatments like photodynamic therapy (PDT), imiquimod, and 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) in terms of percent clearance of AKs. However, it was not significantly different in efficacy compared to other modalities, and no specific safety concerns were highlighted.
population_specificity: Immunocompetent patients with actinic keratosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of oral cryotherapy on oral mucositis in cancer patients and assess the certainty of the evidence supporting its use.
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced the occurrence and severity of oral mucositis, including overall, moderate to severe, and severe cases, compared to control groups, though the certainty of evidence was rated very low.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy combined with immunomodulators versus photodynamic therapy combined with immunomodulators in treating multiple plantar warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with immunomodulators showed a success rate of 39.47% after 3 months, with a higher recurrence rate (53.33%) and less improvement in quality of life (DLQI score 6.31 ± 2.59) compared to photodynamic therapy.
population_specificity: 61 patients with multiple plantar warts visiting an outpatient department from September 2017 to August 2019.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the time taken for complete clearance of plantar warts between topical adapalene gel 0.1% and cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy resulted in complete clearance of plantar warts in a mean time of 50.404±3.178 days, which was slower than adapalene gel (35.619±3.154 days). The study concluded that adapalene gel was faster in clearing lesions.
population_specificity: 84 patients with plantar warts treated at PNS Shifa Hospital, Karachi.
study_duration: Follow-up from treatment onset until complete clearance (mean ~50 days for cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the literature to assess the role of cryotherapy and other treatments in managing cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), particularly in advanced or metastatic cases.
results_summary: The abstract notes that cryotherapy is among the successful treatments for most cutaneous SCC lesions, but it does not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone. The focus shifts to immunotherapy (anti-PD1 agents) for advanced or refractory cases.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), including locally advanced or metastatic cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the appropriateness of cryotherapy as a treatment option for nail unit squamous cell carcinoma in situ, particularly in cases where surgical intervention is not preferred.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy may be appropriate in specific circumstances but is generally limited by lack of evidence or impracticalities compared to other treatments like Mohs micrographic surgery or radiotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with nail unit squamous cell carcinoma in situ, particularly those with subungual involvement or poor surgical candidacy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of partial body cryotherapy (PBC) and cold water immersion (CWI) on circulating peripheral blood mononuclear cells to understand their impact on inflammatory processes.
results_summary: The study found that a single PBC exposure was compared to CWI and a control, with blood samples, heart rate, and blood pressure measured before and after exposure. Cytometric analysis indicated changes in CD8 cells, but full results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 26 males
effective_dosage: PBC (3 min at -110 to -140 °C), CWI (3 min at 9 °C), control (3 min at 24 °C)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical practice guidelines on ankle sprain management, including the effectiveness and recommendation of cryotherapy as a treatment option.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy is one of the highly recommended treatments for ankle sprain management, supported by sufficient evidence for clinical application. It was included among six other effective interventions like functional supports and early ambulation.
population_specificity: Individuals with lateral ankle sprains, as reviewed in clinical practice guidelines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify barriers preventing HPV-positive women in rural Kenya from accessing timely cryotherapy treatment after cervical cancer screening.
results_summary: The study found that transportation costs, long distances to treatment centers, poor understanding of HPV/cervical cancer, and social/family obligations were major barriers to cryotherapy uptake. Despite intentions to seek treatment, none of the 81 interviewed women had undergone cryotherapy, with some facing additional obstacles like pregnancy disqualification.
population_specificity: HPV-positive women in rural Migori County, Kenya, participating in a self-collected HPV screening trial.
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up period for non-attendance was 60 days post-results)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effects of perioperative interventions, including cryotherapy, on reducing facial swelling and improving neck and face sensation after transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy.
results_summary: The study found that interventions like 24-hour intermittent cryotherapy significantly reduced facial swelling (I/II degree) compared to the control group and improved postoperative comfort, edema dissipation, and patient satisfaction.
population_specificity: 60 patients undergoing transoral endoscopic thyroidectomy, divided into observation and control groups (30 each).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of topical treatments for seborrheic keratoses (SKs), comparing them to first-line treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that topical treatments such as hydrogen peroxide, Maxacalcitol, and others showed good-to-excellent response for SK removal, but no direct comparison to cryotherapy was made. Cryotherapy was mentioned as a first-line treatment, but its efficacy and safety were not evaluated in this review.
population_specificity: Patients with seborrheic keratoses (SKs) seeking removal for cosmetic reasons or irritation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of topical Lip-AmB 0.4% in combination with or without cryotherapy for treating cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy combined with Lip-AmB 0.4% or standard treatment showed high efficacy (92% complete cure) and safety, with only minor adverse effects like tolerable burning. Cryotherapy alone had lower efficacy (48.5% complete cure) compared to combined treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis lesions caused by Leishmania major in Iran.
effective_dosage: Biweekly cryotherapy combined with weekly intralesional meglumine antimoniate or daily intramuscular meglumine antimoniate (20 mg/kg/day for 14 days).
study_duration: 28 days for Lip-AmB 0.4%; cryotherapy duration not explicitly stated but implied biweekly over the study period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association of sex with the development of treatment-warranted ROP, including cryotherapy among other treatments.
results_summary: The study found that more male infants were treated for ROP than female infants, but it did not specifically isolate or analyze cryotherapy's effects separately. The overall treatment efficacy and safety for cryotherapy were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Preterm infants (male and female) with retinopathy of prematurity (ROP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy among various chemical and physical destructive therapies for treating non-genital warts.
results_summary: The study included cryotherapy as one of the evaluated therapies but noted that very few treatment options, including cryotherapy, have been studied through RCTs. No specific efficacy data for cryotherapy were highlighted in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with non-genital warts.

study_goal: The researchers sought to summarize available evidence on the utilization of focal therapy, specifically cryotherapy, in oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPC).
results_summary: The study found that cryosurgery followed by androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) demonstrated longer progression-free survival and time to castration resistance in bone metastatic prostate cancer compared to ADT alone, though efficacy data for cryotherapy in OMPC remain scarce.
population_specificity: Patients with oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPC) and bone metastatic prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether local cryotherapy combined with standard therapy improves outcomes in post-mastectomy lymphedema patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with traditional physical therapy showed significant improvement in reducing lymphedema compared to traditional therapy alone, as measured by circumferential measurements and ultrasonography. The study concluded that cryotherapy is an effective adjunct modality for lymphedema rehabilitation.
population_specificity: Forty post-mastectomy female patients aged 40-60 years with lymphedema.
effective_dosage: Pulsed local cryotherapy three times per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a time-to-isolation (TTI)-based strategy of cryoballoon ablation (CBA) for treating atrial fibrillation (AF), comparing it to conventional CBA protocols.
results_summary: The study found that a high-dose TTI strategy (>120s post-TTI) significantly increased freedom from atrial arrhythmia, reduced procedure time, and lowered phrenic nerve palsy incidence compared to conventional protocols. Pooled results showed marginally similar success rates between the two protocols overall.
population_specificity: Patients with atrial fibrillation (N=2289 across nine studies).
effective_dosage: High-dose TTI strategy (>120s duration of cryotherapy post-TTI).

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically address Cryotherapy; it discusses endoscopic management options for Barrett's esophagus with dysplasia and early esophageal adenocarcinoma.
results_summary: The abstract does not report findings on Cryotherapy; it focuses on endoscopic eradication methods, surveillance, and high-dose proton-pump inhibitor therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus with dysplasia and early esophageal adenocarcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryoballoon ablation as a first-line therapy for atrial fibrillation compared to antiarrhythmic drugs.
results_summary: Cryoballoon ablation significantly improved arrhythmia outcomes, patient-reported quality of life, and reduced healthcare utilization without increasing adverse events. The findings support its use as an initial rhythm-control therapy for treatment-naive AF patients.
