population_specificity: Patients with treatment-naive atrial fibrillation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how cryotherapy, among other focal therapies, enhances the immune response in prostate cancer (PC) treatment.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy, along with other focal therapies, can boost the anti-cancer immune response, though its application is currently restricted to clinical trials or prospective cohort studies.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to map and synthesize existing literature on topical therapies, including cryotherapy, for pain management in malignant fungating wounds.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was identified as one of twenty therapies used for pain management in malignant fungating wounds, appearing in 5.7% of the selected studies, but its effectiveness was not specifically detailed due to limited interventional studies.
population_specificity: Adults with malignant fungating wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the recurrence rates of odontogenic keratocysts (OKC) treated with enucleation combined with cryotherapy (E + CRYO) against other treatment options.
results_summary: The study found that enucleation with cryotherapy (E + CRYO) was included in the analysis but did not rank among the top three most effective treatments. The most effective treatments were E + PO + 5FU, resection, and E ± PO + CS. Cryotherapy's efficacy was not statistically superior to other methods, and its performance was not highlighted in the results.
population_specificity: Patients with odontogenic keratocysts (OKC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy is effective in managing oral mucositis in patients undergoing stem cell transplantation.
results_summary: The systematic review of nine randomized controlled trials found that cryotherapy had a positive effect on reducing oral mucositis in stem cell transplantation patients, with no significant publication bias detected.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing stem cell transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost utility and efficacy of home-based cryotherapy devices versus in-hospital liquid nitrogen therapy for treating cutaneous warts.
results_summary: Home-based cryotherapy showed slightly higher efficacy (72.8%) compared to in-hospital therapy (64.3%) and was more cost-effective ($76.03 vs. $100.45). Both methods had similar side effects (pain, redness, burning) and quality-adjusted life years.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous warts.
study_duration: Monthly follow-up until cure (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review policies for cervical cancer prevention and control in sub-Saharan African countries with high HIV prevalence, including the use of cryotherapy as a treatment method.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was the most commonly recommended treatment method (100%) for cervical cancer in the reviewed policies, alongside other methods like VIA and LEEP. The study highlighted the need for tailored policies for women living with HIV but did not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Women in sub-Saharan African countries with high HIV prevalence, particularly women living with HIV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of high-frequency vibration combined with cryotherapy on self-reported pain and anxiety levels during intramuscular Influenza vaccination in adults.
results_summary: The study proposed to compare pain and anxiety levels between a control group receiving standard vaccination and an intervention group using high-frequency vibration with cryotherapy, but results were not yet reported in the abstract.
population_specificity: Adults receiving the Influenza vaccine in a Brazilian Primary Health Care Unit.
effective_dosage: High-frequency vibration associated with cryotherapy applied for 30 seconds before and during vaccine administration.
study_duration: 30 seconds before and during vaccine administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical profile, treatment outcomes, and visual acuity changes in patients with Coats disease, including the role of cryotherapy in management.
results_summary: Cryotherapy ± intravitreal bevacizumab/triamcinolone acetonide was used in 23% of cases, but no significant difference in visual acuity was observed between presenting and final outcomes. The study did not isolate cryotherapy's specific efficacy compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Patients in India diagnosed with Coats disease (mean age 16.8 years, 75% male, predominantly unilateral presentation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of kinesiology tape and cryotherapy (ice pack application) in reducing postoperative symptoms after mandibular third molar extraction.
results_summary: Cryotherapy (group 2) significantly reduced postoperative swelling, pain, and mouth opening limitation compared to no intervention (group 3), with similar efficacy to kinesiology tape (group 1), though patients reported fewer problems with kinesiology tape.
population_specificity: Patients with mandibular third molar extraction indications.
effective_dosage: Intermittent cryotherapy within 24 h of the operation (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy versus thermocoagulation for treating VIA-positive cervical lesions in women from a low- to middle-income setting.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed an efficacy of 90.32% but had significantly more immediate side effects compared to thermocoagulation. The study concluded that thermocoagulation may offer better patient comfort and safety despite similar efficacy.
population_specificity: 68 women with VIA-positive cervical lesions in India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of prophylactic retinopexy (including cryotherapy) in reducing retinal detachment risk in Stickler syndrome patients.
results_summary: The study found strong evidence supporting the efficacy and safety of prophylactic retinopexy, including cryotherapy, in reducing retinal detachment risk in Stickler syndrome patients, though it does not eliminate the risk entirely. The review highlights the importance of informed decision-making for patients and their families.
population_specificity: Stickler syndrome patients, particularly children at high risk of retinal detachment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the scientific evidence on cryolipolysis's effects, adverse reactions, and satisfaction levels for reducing subcutaneous adipose tissue.
results_summary: Most studies showed significant results for cryolipolysis in reducing localized fat, with rare and transient adverse effects. Combining cryolipolysis with a dietary program improved lipid profiles and liver enzymes, unlike cryolipolysis alone.
population_specificity: Humans (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of intralesional 5-fluorouracil (5-FU + LE) injection with cryotherapy in treating common and palmoplantar warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 35.7% complete response rate, less reduction in wart thickness, more severe pain, and less improvement in quality of life compared to 5-FU + LE, though the overall efficacy difference was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 45 patients with common and palmoplantar warts.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy administered once weekly for six sessions.
study_duration: Six weeks (once weekly for six sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify predictors of nab-paclitaxel-induced peripheral neuropathy in patients receiving cryotherapy or compression therapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy and compression therapy had comparable efficacy in preventing peripheral neuropathy, but some patients still developed significant neuropathy. Smoking history, BMI, and age were identified as significant predictors of neuropathy development.
population_specificity: 38 breast cancer patients receiving chemotherapy with nanoparticle albumin-bound paclitaxel (nab-PTX).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Cryotherapy as an alternative treatment option for desmoid tumors with compatible locations and tumor sizes.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is mentioned as an alternative option for desmoid tumors, but no specific efficacy data or outcomes are provided in the abstract. The study primarily focuses on other treatments like kinase inhibitors and cytotoxic agents.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive desmoid tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the risks of treatment failure and preterm birth associated with Cryotherapy versus other cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) treatment techniques.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was associated with a higher risk of treatment failure compared to LLETZ (OR 1.84 [1.33-2.56]), but no significant difference in preterm birth risk was found compared to the untreated colposcopy group (OR 1.01 [0.35-2.92]).
population_specificity: Women with CIN, glandular intraepithelial neoplasia, or stage IA1 cervical cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review therapeutic aspects and resistance mechanisms of treatments for leishmaniasis, including cryotherapy, in the context of emerging drug resistance.
results_summary: The study reviewed resistance mechanisms in leishmaniasis treatments but did not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effectiveness, only mentioning its use alongside other treatments.
population_specificity: Anthroponotic Leishmania species (e.g., L. donovani, L. tropica) in endemic countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review high-level evidence on postnatal management of perineal trauma, including cryotherapy, to inform evidence-based care strategies.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy, only mentioning it as one of the categories of perineal trauma management reviewed.
population_specificity: Women with perineal injuries up to six months postpartum.

study_goal: The study aimed to explore the effectiveness of topical interventions (including cryotherapy) for preventing or reducing nail changes induced by taxane-based chemotherapy in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that specialist nail drops and standard care were more effective than nail polish in reducing nail toxicity, but cryotherapy was not directly evaluated in the results. Future investigations into cryotherapy were suggested.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer undergoing taxane-based chemotherapy (105 participants, 20% over 60 years old).
study_duration: Monitored up to three months post-chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine if an opioid-sparing pain-control regimen, including continuous cryotherapy, could achieve equivalent pain scores and satisfaction compared to a traditional opioid-based regimen after shoulder arthroplasty.
results_summary: The opioid-sparing group, which included continuous cryotherapy, showed significantly reduced opioid consumption (nearly 4-fold reduction) and higher satisfaction with pain management, with no difference in pain scores, ROM, or complications compared to the opioid-based group.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary anatomic or reverse total shoulder arthroplasty.
study_duration: Intervention administered from admission to discharge, with follow-up assessments up to 12 weeks postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in reducing pain and analgesic use following ACL and/or meniscal tears.
results_summary: The study found low-certainty evidence that cryotherapy reduces pain and analgesic use in individuals with ACL injuries. No significant adverse effects or lack of efficacy was reported.
population_specificity: Young adults with ACL injuries (mostly men).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of cryotherapy on pain scores and satisfaction levels during cataract surgery under topical anesthesia.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced intraoperative pain scores and improved the quality of operating conditions for surgeons, but no significant differences were found in postoperative pain scores or opioid consumption.
population_specificity: 80 patients aged 55-75 years scheduled for cataract surgery.
study_duration: Duration of the surgical procedure (exact time not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the limited evidence for nonsurgical treatments, including cryotherapy, for nonmalignant central airway obstruction (NMCAO) and motivate further research.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a promising therapeutic option but does not provide specific results regarding its effectiveness for NMCAO. The study highlights the need for more research to determine long-term outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with nonmalignant central airway obstruction (NMCAO).

study_goal: The study does not specifically aim to evaluate Cryotherapy but mentions it as one of several treatment options for relapsing histiocytosis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is listed as a reported treatment option for histiocytosis, but the study does not provide specific results or outcomes related to its use.
population_specificity: Patients with relapsing group C histiocytosis (cutaneous and mucocutaneous manifestations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of Whole-Body Cryostimulation (WBC) as an adjuvant treatment for obesity, focusing on its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and weight-reducing potential.
results_summary: The review found limited but supportive evidence that WBC reduces systemic inflammation, oxidative stress, abdominal obesity, and body mass, with effects mimicking exercise. However, definitive conclusions on efficacy were not possible due to insufficient high-quality studies.
population_specificity: Patients with obesity

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of photodynamic therapy (PDT) with cryotherapy in treating warts caused by HPV infection.
results_summary: PDT showed a statistically significant improvement in wart clearance rate compared to cryotherapy (P < 0.009) for hand and foot warts, but the abstract does not detail cryotherapy's standalone efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Patients with hand and foot warts and condyloma acuminatum caused by HPV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical relevance and technical characteristics of cryotherapy (CT) as an alternative thermal ablation method for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: Cryotherapy is mentioned as an alternative, less frequently employed thermal procedure for HCC ablation, but its use is limited due to insufficient evidence, primarily reserved for individual cases and study frameworks. Non-thermal methods are preferred for tumors near critical structures like blood vessels and bile ducts.
population_specificity: Patients with very early (BCLC 0) and early (BCLC A) hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare HPV detection differences between HIV-infected and HIV-uninfected women undergoing cervical dysplasia treatment via cryotherapy or LEEP.
results_summary: The study found differences in HPV detection among HIV-infected and HIV-uninfected women treated with cryotherapy, suggesting HIV status may influence treatment outcomes. It also highlighted the benefits of antiretroviral therapy on HPV persistence in this context.
population_specificity: HIV-infected and HIV-uninfected women in East Africa undergoing treatment for cervical dysplasia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence, clinical characteristics, and demographic factors of melanocytic lesions of the ocular surface in a Hispanic population, including the use of cryotherapy for treatment.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in one case of primary acquired melanosis, requiring excisional biopsy and cryotherapy, with no reported adverse effects or recurrence. The study found cryotherapy effective in this single case.
population_specificity: Hispanic patients attending a tertiary referral ophthalmological center in northern Mexico.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effectiveness of oral cryotherapy (OC) in preventing chemotherapy-induced oral mucositis (OM) in patients with haematological malignancies undergoing hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT).
results_summary: Seven out of nine randomized controlled trials demonstrated significant effectiveness of OC in reducing the incidence of severe OM, particularly in patients receiving high-dose alkylating agents like melphalan. The review supports OC's use for OM prevention in HCT patients but calls for more studies to compare efficacy and duration across different chemotherapeutic agents.
population_specificity: Adult patients with haematological malignancies undergoing HCT, particularly those receiving high-dose melphalan conditioning protocols.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy in treating plantar warts compared to alternative treatments.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed lower cure rates than other treatments (OR 0.31, 95% CI 0.12-0.78) with substantial heterogeneity. The study suggests cryotherapy may be less effective for plantar warts compared to alternatives.
population_specificity: Patients with plantar warts (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of the FGF/FGFR system in ocular tumors and explore its potential for prognostic and therapeutic applications, including existing treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that current treatments, including cryotherapy, achieve local tumor control in most cases but notes a significant percentage of patients still develop metastatic disease. The study highlights the need for novel targets to improve outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with ocular tumors (retina, uvea, or vitreous origin).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Cryotherapy as a treatment for genital condyloma acuminata, particularly in comparison to other treatment options.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was listed as a physician-administered treatment with a Level of Evidence (LE) of 1b, indicating moderate to strong evidence supporting its efficacy for treating genital warts. The abstract does not provide specific outcome data for Cryotherapy alone but groups it among other effective treatments.
population_specificity: Adults in Asia, including patients with HIV co-infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes of cryotherapy with other surgical techniques for treating distichiasis in human and animal eyes.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy's outcomes were inferior to surgical excision of distichiatic lashes, with existing treatments for acquired distichiasis offering success rates of only 50%-60%. Blind procedures like cryotherapy may benefit from further research on distichiatic eyelash depth.
population_specificity: Human and animal eyes with congenital or acquired distichiasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review population-based estimates of keratinocyte cancer incidence in Australia, analyze trends over time, and calculate lifetime risk, including the role of treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that treatment rates for keratinocyte cancer, including cryotherapy/curettage, have increased over time, particularly in individuals aged 55 years or older. However, the abstract does not provide specific efficacy or safety data for cryotherapy itself.
population_specificity: Adults in Australia, with a focus on those aged 55 years or older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether HPV screen-and-treat with immediate cryotherapy improved outcomes for high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (bHSIL) compared to cytology-based screening in women with HIV.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in time to bHSIL between immediate cryotherapy and cytology-based screening, with similar prevalence of hrHPV at follow-up. Cryotherapy did not improve bHSIL outcomes compared to standard screening.
population_specificity: Women with HIV, aged 18 or older, with cervical hrHPV and no cervical lesions or lesions appropriate for cryotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether contrast with compression (CwC) therapy enhances recovery of muscle function, reduces markers of exercise-associated muscle damage (EAMD), and mitigates glycogen storage disruption after eccentric exercise.
results_summary: CwC therapy significantly improved recovery of muscular strength, power, and joint mobility while attenuating (but not eliminating) the disruption of intramuscular glycogen stores post-exercise. It also reduced markers of EAMD, such as creatine kinase levels and muscle soreness.
population_specificity: Ten male participants.
effective_dosage: CwC therapy applied at 0, 24, and 48 hours post-exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current status of cryoablation in clinical practice, explore opportunities to enhance therapeutic outcomes, and discuss emerging research, including nanoparticle-mediated cryotherapy and combinational cryo-based immunotherapies.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation shows superior tumor response and quicker recovery time compared to heat-based ablation techniques. Emerging research suggests nanocarriers may improve cryoablation therapy by enhancing imaging guidance, therapeutic delivery, and immune modulation.
population_specificity: Patients with various solid tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in treating melanocytic tumors, particularly its efficacy compared to other treatments like topical interferon alpha 2b (IFN-α2b).
results_summary: The abstract mentions that topical IFN-α2b has been successfully applied to melanocytic tumors refractory to other treatments, including cryotherapy, suggesting cryotherapy may be less effective in some cases. No specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone is provided.
population_specificity: Patients with primary acquired melanosis (PAM) or conjunctival melanoma (CM), particularly those with refractory or recurrent disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryo-alcohol therapy (cryotherapy combined with topical ethanol) in managing refractory fungal and acanthamoeba scleritis.
results_summary: The study found that cryo-alcohol therapy led to resolution of fungal scleritis in 6 weeks (BCVA 20/20) and acanthamoeba scleritis in 8 weeks, with literature review showing BCVA >20/200 in 50% of fungal scleritis cases and varying evisceration rates.
population_specificity: Patients with fungal or acanthamoeba scleritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the oncologic control and functional preservation of focal cryotherapy for localized prostate cancer in the modern era of MRI-guided treatment.
results_summary: Focal cryotherapy showed low to moderate recurrence rates (0-51%) and variable rates of freedom from radical treatment (46-98%). Adverse events like erectile dysfunction (0-44%) and incontinence (0-12%) were reported, with variability across modalities.
population_specificity: Men with localized, MRI-visible prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of repetitive cryotherapy (cryothermogenesis) for body contouring of the abdomen and saddlebag areas.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in body mass index, waist measurements, and saddlebag circumference, confirmed by iDXA scans, indicating fat mass reduction in treated areas without complications.
population_specificity: Premenopausal women with subcutaneous abdominal and saddlebag adipose tissue overload (average BMI 23.0 ± 1.41 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Five cryothermogenesis sessions using a medical device with two cooling probes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a historical perspective on cryotherapy, highlighting its origins and assessing its evolving role in recovery and treatment techniques.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy can reduce pain perception, improve well-being, and potentially aid post-exercise recovery by altering blood flow and reducing inflammation. It also suggests that historical insights could generate new research questions and perspectives.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human application implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on pain, disease activity, functional capacity, cytokine levels, and analgesic use in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
results_summary: WBC significantly reduced pain and disease activity, improved functional capacity, and altered cytokine levels (TNF and IL-6) in RA patients. These effects were clinically meaningful and led to reduced analgesic use, with benefits persisting at the 12-week follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with active rheumatoid arthritis undergoing multimodal rheumatologic complex treatment.
effective_dosage: 6 applications in 14 days at -130°C for 3 minutes each.
study_duration: 16-day multimodal treatment with WBC administered over 14 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of local hyperthermia at 43°C versus liquid nitrogen cryotherapy for treating plane warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy had a clearance rate of 31.25%, a recurrence rate of 53.33%, and an adverse event rate of 83.33%, with higher pain scores and longer healing times compared to local hyperthermia.
population_specificity: Patients with plane warts (194 enrolled, 183 analyzed).
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy was delivered in two sessions 2 weeks apart.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy compared to other conservative treatments for adhesive capsulitis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be effective in treating adhesive capsulitis, unlike ultrasound therapy. The study highlighted its efficacy alongside radial shockwaves and joint mobilizations.
population_specificity: Patients with adhesive capsulitis (stage of disease, ROM reduction, and duration of complaints varied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare current therapies, including cryotherapy, for conjunctival melanoma (CM) and explore the potential of novel immunomodulatory treatments.
results_summary: The abstract notes that current therapies like cryotherapy combined with surgical excision still have high recurrence and metastatic rates, highlighting the need for improved treatments such as immune checkpoint inhibitors.
population_specificity: Patients with conjunctival melanoma (CM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy against 595-nm pulsed dye laser and microwave tissue coagulation for treating verruca vulgaris in children.
results_summary: Cryotherapy had a response rate of 66.7%, lower than the other treatments, and the highest adverse reaction rate (63.3%). It required more treatments (average 4.63 ± 0.96) compared to the other methods.
population_specificity: 90 children with verruca vulgaris treated in a dermatology outpatient department.
effective_dosage: Once every two weeks, maximum of six treatments.
study_duration: Up to 12 weeks (6 treatments over 14-week period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the recurrence rate of external genital warts (EGW) after cryotherapy when followed by sequential topical sinecatechins 10% treatment.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy followed by sinecatechins reduced EGW recurrence to 18% (vs. 45% without sequential therapy), with significant lesion reduction (P=0.0001) and good tolerability. New lesions outside treated areas occurred in 10 subjects, but no serious side effects were reported.
population_specificity: 55 subjects (36 men, 19 women; mean age 47±10 years) with multiple EGW (mean 9±7 lesions).
study_duration: 4 months of topical treatment, with 6-month total follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the importance of familiarity with basic in-office skin procedures, including cryotherapy, for addressing common skin conditions in primary care.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects but emphasizes its utility among other procedural interventions for common skin issues.
population_specificity: Clinicians in primary care settings encountering various skin conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, tolerability, and safety of cryotherapy and other treatments for actinic keratosis, comparing their clearance rates and adverse effects.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is one of the most used physical ablative techniques for isolated actinic keratosis lesions, with a good profile of efficacy and tolerability. No differences in efficacy and tolerability were found between older and younger patients, and no dose adjustments were needed.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis, including older and immunosuppressed individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the visual and anatomical outcomes of air tamponade (AT) versus gas tamponade (GT) in repairing rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RRD), including the role of cryotherapy in these procedures.
results_summary: The study found that AT had comparable success rates (95%) to GT (96%) in primary macula-on RRD repair, with cryopexy used in 64% of AT cases and 58% of GT cases. AT also resulted in faster postoperative rehabilitation and fewer cataract surgeries compared to GT.
population_specificity: Patients with primary macula-on rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RRD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the German S3 guidelines on focal therapy (including Cryotherapy) for localized prostate cancer, focusing on diagnostic work-up, indications, modalities, and follow-up.
results_summary: The study highlights that the German S3 guidelines provide evidence- and consensus-based recommendations for focal therapy, including Cryotherapy, in treating localized prostate cancer, with specific criteria for indication, pretreatment, and follow-up. It notes the lack of prospective controlled trial data for most focal therapy modalities but emphasizes the guidelines' structured approach.
population_specificity: Men with localized prostate cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of cold therapy in reducing paclitaxel-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) and establish the incidence of CIPN in gynecological cancer patients.
results_summary: Cold therapy significantly reduced CIPN incidence from 100% in the control group to 48.7% in the intervention group, with effects observed from the first chemotherapy cycle to the 1-month follow-up. Four patients discontinued due to pain, but no serious adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Gynecological cancer patients aged over 18 years receiving paclitaxel-based chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (frozen gloves used, but exact cryotherapy parameters not detailed).
study_duration: From the first chemotherapy cycle to 1 month post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review non-laser treatment options for tattoo removal, including cryotherapy, and compare their cosmetic outcomes and limitations.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, like other non-laser treatments, is associated with unsatisfactory cosmetic results due to adverse effects such as scarring and dyspigmentation. It highlighted the limitations of cryotherapy compared to laser treatments, which remain the gold standard despite their own drawbacks.
population_specificity: Individuals seeking tattoo removal, particularly those in the second to fourth decade of life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of intralesional vitamin D3 and cryotherapy in treating cutaneous warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed effectiveness in treating cutaneous warts, but intralesional vitamin D3 was statistically more effective in achieving complete resolution (p-value <0.05). Both therapies had good response rates, with plantar warts being the most common type treated.
population_specificity: 50 patients with cutaneous warts (24 female, 26 male) at the dermatology department of Pak Emirates Military Hospital Rawalpindi.

study_goal: The abstract does not mention Cryotherapy or its evaluation.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss Cryotherapy or its effects.
population_specificity: Patients with neovascular glaucoma (NVG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy alone, intralesional tuberculin PPD alone, and a combination of both in treating multiple common warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with intralesional tuberculin PPD and tuberculin PPD alone were both more effective than cryotherapy alone, with the combination showing better response in fewer sessions. No significant difference was found between tuberculin PPD alone and the combined treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with multiple common warts (75 participants divided into three groups of 25 each).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with thermal ablation for treating cervical precancer lesions, focusing on logistical challenges and treatment efficacy in low-resource settings.
results_summary: The abstract highlights cryotherapy as the most common global treatment for cervical precancer but notes logistical challenges due to gas procurement. It introduces thermal ablation as a WHO-endorsed alternative, detailing three devices and protocols for its use.
population_specificity: Women in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) with high-grade cervical precancer lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of anti-VEGF drugs versus laser photocoagulation (and indirectly cryotherapy) for treating type 1 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP).
results_summary: Anti-VEGF likely reduces refractive errors compared to laser photocoagulation, but shows little to no difference in mortality, lens/corneal opacity, or retinal detachment. The evidence on recurrence risk is inconclusive due to very low certainty.
population_specificity: Preterm infants with type 1 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of cryotherapy on pain intensity in the immediate postoperative period of ACL reconstruction.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found effective in reducing pain intensity, with subjective pain scale scores showing reductions. Cryocompression was superior to conventional cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Individuals in the postoperative period of anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) repair.
study_duration: Immediate postoperative period (specific duration not mentioned)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical effectiveness of local hyperthermia versus cryotherapy for treating plantar warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved a 54.3% complete clearance rate for plantar warts after three months, with a 12% recurrence rate. Pain scores during cryotherapy were significantly higher than during local hyperthermia.
population_specificity: 1,027 patients with plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the treatment modality with the lowest recurrence rate for odontogenic keratocysts, including the role of adjunctive therapies like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found no recurrences in cysts treated with adjunctive therapies, including cryotherapy, suggesting a benefit in reducing recurrence rates compared to enucleation alone.
population_specificity: 50 patients with odontogenic keratocysts (56 cysts) treated at UHCW NHS Trust over 14 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the frequency and severity of peripheral neuropathy (PN) and quality of life in breast cancer patients receiving cold therapy versus standard care during paclitaxel infusions.
results_summary: Patients on standard therapy were three times more likely to develop PN, with progression toward severe PN, compared to those on cold therapy. However, cold therapy had no effect on quality of life.
population_specificity: 48 female breast cancer patients receiving weekly paclitaxel infusions.
study_duration: 12 weeks of intervention with follow-up at 16 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of cryotherapy as a treatment for cutaneous Kaposi sarcoma (KS) in a patient with B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was relatively simple and had few adverse effects, suggesting it may be a safe and simple treatment for cutaneous KS. However, more studies are needed to further evaluate its effectiveness.
population_specificity: An 87-year-old patient with B-cell CLL and cutaneous KS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy compared to oral albendazole in treating cutaneous larva migrans (CLM).
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be ineffective in treating CLM, while oral albendazole resulted in complete resolution of symptoms without recurrence after 6 months.
population_specificity: A 49-year-old woman with CLM after traveling to Honduras.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, tolerability, and long-term effectiveness of topical calcipotriol plus 5-FU combination for field-directed therapy of AK, including its comparison with cryotherapy in one retrospective study.
results_summary: The abstract mentions a retrospective study evaluating the use of calcipotriol plus 5-FU with cryotherapy, but no specific results about cryotherapy's effects are provided. The primary focus was on the combination therapy's efficacy and long-term outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis (AK) and those at risk for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and comfort of hilotherapy versus frozen gloves in preventing taxane-related toxicities at the extremities in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: Hilotherapy showed significantly lower incidence of ≥ grade 2 side-effects (43.6% vs. 61.3%) and better perceived comfort compared to frozen gloves, though overall side-effect incidence was similar.
population_specificity: Patients with early breast cancer treated with weekly paclitaxel.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy for treating extra-abdominal desmoid tumors.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a low rate of major (4.2%) and minor (10.2%) complications, with an 85.8% non-progressive disease rate and high pain relief (87.5% with VAS reduction ≥3). Progression-free survival was 84.5% at 1 year and 78.0% at 3 years.
population_specificity: Patients with extra-abdominal desmoid tumors.
